page.title: 01THAMES-SIDE MARSHLANDS
page.content: A very quiet part of {South-East {England}which,being sparsely populated,provides an ideal habitat for wildlife. There is one small hamlet known as Church Street situated north of the village of Higham in Kent. It consists of a church,a public house and twenty-one houses some of which are several hundred years old but the majority are modern. Part of the area is marshy ground and farmland bisected by the mighty{River Thames}used by both commercial and pleasure craft which,guided by a navigational beacon positioned just East of{Shornemead {Fort},sail between{London}and the { {Thames Estuary}. Three forts,built against possible invasion,still stand at{Cliffe}and{Shornemead}in Kent and at {Coalhouse Point}in Essex.
